> Hal just defines a standard way=
 to express hyperlinks in xml via a simple
> <link> element. The link eleme=
nt has the following attributes: @rel @href
> @name
> =A0- Simple links can=
 be written as solo/self-closing tags.
> =A0- Links used to indicate embedd=
ed representations from other resources
> should be written with open and c=
lose tags, with the embedded representation
> contained within.
> =A0- The =
root element must always be a link with an @rel of self and an
> appropriat=
e @href value.
> =A0- @name must be unique between all links in a document =
with the same @rel
> value, but is not unique within the entire document. i=
.e. a link element
> cannot be referred to by @name alone

e may contain a URI template
